docs.snippet: Norway vowed on Wednesday to ramp up its fight against modern slavery, becoming the second country after Niger to approve a  United Nations treaty designed to give countries the legal muscle to combat forced labour and trafficking....
docs.lead_paragraph: Norway vowed on Wednesday to ramp up its fight against modern slavery, becoming the second country after Niger to approve a  United Nations treaty designed to give countries the legal muscle to combat forced labour and trafficking.

headline.main: Norway Vows to Strengthen Laws to Fight Modern Slavery by Signing U.N. Treaty
headline.print_headline: Norway Vows to Strengthen Laws to Fight Modern Slavery by Signing U.N. Treaty

docs.snippet: A student has not been shot in a New York City school over the past 13 years, an era when school shootings across the United States have become sadly commonplace. But there is a growing cry to rid the city's schools of metal detectors, the very to...
docs.lead_paragraph: A student has not been shot in a New York City school over the past 13 years, an era when school shootings across the United States have become sadly commonplace. But there is a growing cry to rid the city's schools of metal detectors, the very tool some observers credit with keeping them safe.

headline.main: Calls Mount to Remove Metal Detectors From NYC Schools
headline.print_headline: Calls Mount to Remove Metal Detectors From NYC Schools

docs.snippet: On the same downtown block where Nashville police officers carried a young John Lewis by his hands and feet to a paddy wagon for daring to take a seat at a whites-only lunch counter decades ago, today's fresh-faced police recruits are learning les...
docs.lead_paragraph: On the same downtown block where Nashville police officers carried a young John Lewis by his hands and feet to a paddy wagon for daring to take a seat at a whites-only lunch counter decades ago, today's fresh-faced police recruits are learning lessons about the fraught history between law enforcement and black Americans.

headline.main: Nashville Program Teaches Law Enforcement About Civil Rights
headline.print_headline: Nashville Program Teaches Law Enforcement About Civil Rights

docs.snippet: Mexico detained 73 percent more migrants in the first year since the announcement of an operation to shore up security on its southern border, according to a study released Wednesday by human rights groups and migrants' advocates....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mexico detained 73 percent more migrants in the first year since the announcement of an operation to shore up security on its southern border, according to a study released Wednesday by human rights groups and migrants' advocates.

headline.main: Study: Migrant Detentions in Mexico Up 73 Percent Since 2014
headline.print_headline: Study: Migrant Detentions in Mexico Up 73 Percent Since 2014

docs.snippet: Recent defeats have led to second-guessing among lawyers about whether the Manhattan district attorney’s office has made financial trials overly complex....
docs.lead_paragraph: Recent defeats have led to second-guessing among lawyers about whether the Manhattan district attorney’s office has made financial trials overly complex.
docs.abstract: Manhattan Dist Atty Cyrus R Vance Jr disputes suggestions that his office has been too aggressive in pursuing white-collar crimes and has made financial trials overly complex; number of missteps by his office, including mistrial in criminal case against former executives of Dewey & LeBoeuf law firm, have put his office in negative spotlight.

headline.main: Recent Setbacks Cast Harsh Light on Cyrus Vance, the Manhattan Prosecutor
